description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3rto9","text":"This protocol allows users to image histology tissue using basic immunohistochemistry techniques in combination with EdU capture (using the Click-it reaction system).  EdU (5-ethynyl-2′-deoxyuridine) will capture S-phase cells with the thymidine analogue, allowing to take a snap-shot of actively diving cells. In this assay the modified thymidine analogue EdU is efficiently incorporated into newly synthesized DNA and fluorescently labeled with a bright, photostable Alexa Fluor™ dye in a fast, highly-specific click reaction. This fluorescent labeling of proliferating cells is accurate and compatible with antibody methods due to the mild click protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5i869","text":"dU 5-ethynyl-2′-deoxyuridine (200mg/kg/mouse)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43m66","text":"BD Fix/Perm Solution (cat #: 554714)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eda1s","text":"30% Sucrose Solution","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ls8","text":"Tissue-Tek O.C.T. Compound (cat#: 4583; Sakura)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b347m","text":"Tissue-Tek Base Mold System (Sakura): size will depend on organ of interest","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n0ns","text":"SuperFrost Plus slides (cat #: 12-550-15; Fisher)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi6ch","text":"Click-iT™ EdU Cell Proliferation Kit for Imaging, Alexa Fluor™ 555 dye (cat #: C10338; Thermo): A488, A555, A594, A647 work very well! ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gqvi","text":"Optional: TruStain FcX™ (anti-mouse CD16/32) Antibody (cat#: 101319; Biolegend)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ln0n","text":"Optional: primary/secondary antibody needed for wanted panel","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p048","text":"Optional DAPI","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abm7n","text":"Optional Flouromount G (cat #: 00-4958-02, Thermo)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k279","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6mnt","text":"Inject animals with EdU as outlined in animal protocol license (typically by performing an intra-peritoneal injection with 200 mg/kg per mouse). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75s0k","text":"Euthanize animal and harvest organ of interest: place tissue in 0.1% BD cytofix/cytoperm fixative (0/N at 4C).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b9cm","text":"Time of euthanasia after EdU injection will vary widely on organ/cell of interest, and age of the animal. For an optimal time window- prior literature should be investigated. For fast proliferating tissues (such as intestinal epithelium or skin), a good starting point will be around 1-4hrs; for developing embryos, 20-30min might be sufficient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t5b2","text":"The following day, place fixed in tissue in 30% Sucrose Solution (allowing the tissue to get dehydrated).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4agi6","text":"Embed tissue in Tissue-Tek Base Mold System by orienting the tissue in its optimal configuration in OCT Mounting Media. Freeze tissue on dry ice until OCT turns from a viscous clear compound to a solid white. OCT blocks can be stored at -80C long term (months). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24ot4","text":"Section OCT blocks on a cryostat at desired thickness on SuperFrost Plus slides. Tested so far are up to 50um in thickness. If desired, sectioned slides can be stored at -20C long term (months).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue staining with EdU, antibodies, and Mounting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2qsje","text":"Place tissue slides in humidity chamber, and hydrate tissue sample with PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue staining with EdU, antibodies, and Mounting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ah9c9","text":"Block tissue section using Blocking Buffer (composed with 0.3% Triton, Fc-block,  and 1x BD Perm/Wash (+ Fc-block if needed)). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue staining with EdU, antibodies, and Mounting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ijjr","text":"Stain sample with EdU Click-it reaction solution following the instructions from the manufacturer. EdU staining is extremely bright- 30min will be sufficient to stain efficiently a 25um section. 45min staining is advised for thicker sections. The copper concentrations typically used in traditional click chemistry reactions can affect fluorophores such as GFP, mCherry, R-PE, and R-PE tandem dyes. Highly recommend to 1) stain for EdU before other antibodies (either conjugated-primaries or secondaries), and 2) stain with anti-fluorophore antibodies (such as anti-GFP). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue staining with EdU, antibodies, and Mounting
Tissue staining with EdU, antibodies, and Mounting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5088s","text":"Continue staining samples with wanted panel (primary, secondary and/or Nuclear Dye (such as DAPI)). For follow-up quantification (for example: % EdU+ cells), DAPI staining is very much important. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tissue staining with EdU, antibodies, and Mounting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"crqjb","text":"Mount samples with preferred mounting media (recommended is Fluoromount G). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: EdU Immunohistochemistry using Click-it reaction
